page.title: 13Margam Park. Sculpture Park
page.content: The exhibition 'Sculpture in a Country Park' was opened in June 1983 and was the first open-air event to be staged by the Welsh Sculpture Trust. Works by leading sculptors such as Henry Moore, Barbara Hepworth and Elizabeth Frink can be seen and experienced by all visitors regardless of any prior declared interests in the parks richly diverse environment. During the summer, sculptors may be seen actually making the work and children are in- vited to participate making sculptures for themselves. After two successful years, the exhibition reached the end of its life. However, in 1985 over two thirds of the original sculptures remain to form the basis of a semi permanent collection. The siting of certain sculptures caused much local controversy.
